name: Mixing Pot Quiz | Mixed 20 Questions | 20 Questions

questions.text: According to the movie "The Ring" how long can you survive trapped in a well?
questions.explanation:
7 days.

	In the movie after you watch The Tape you get a phone call that says you will die in seven days.

questions.text: Clay Aiken won American Idol 2?
questions.explanation:
False.

	Clay Aiken had the most votes but during the process of voting the votes for Clay Aiken were lost so Ruben Studdard ended up winning:(

questions.text: What is the name of the founder of Hershey chocolate?
questions.explanation:
Milton S. Hershey

	The Hershey Factory and Amusement Park are in Hershey Pennsylvania.

questions.text: What city do the White Sox play for?
questions.explanation:
Chicago.

	They are also called the Chisox.

questions.text: What year was Anne Frank and everyone else in the Annex discovered?
questions.explanation:
1944.

	They had to go into hiding during WW2 because they were Jewish and trying to avoid arrest. They were discovered on August 4, 1944. Anne died a few weeks before her camp was liberated in 1945.

questions.text: In mythology who did Hades take to be his wife?
questions.explanation:
Persephone.

	Persephone ate six (in some stories seven) pomegranate seeds and had to stay with Hades for six months of the year. In that time Demeter is in mourning and nothing grows. The origin of the seasons.

0.

	Anything multiplied by zero is zero!

questions.text: Who plays Kimmy Gibbler on the television show 'Full House'?
questions.explanation:
Andrea Barber.

	Candace Cameron- DJJodie Sweetin- StephanieLori Laughlin- Aunt Becky

questions.text: Who was King Henry VIII's third wife?
questions.explanation:
Jane Seymour.

	Jane Seymour was the wife who gave birth to his only son, Edward. She died shortly after childbirth.

questions.text: On the television series "The O.C." Ryan's girlfriend is Summer?
questions.explanation:
False.

	Ryan's girlfriend is Marissa.

questions.text:
"Oh, say can you see by the dawn's early light 
What so proudly we hailed at the twilight's last ___"
questions.explanation:
gleaming.

	It was written by Francis Scott Key during the War of 1812 on the back of an envelope.

questions.text: Who sings the song "Beautiful"?
questions.explanation:
Christina Aguilera.

	Her dad is from Ecuador. She was in the Mickey Mouse Club and friends with Britney Spears.

questions.text: In the movie "Mr. Deeds", how did Deeds get rich?
questions.explanation:
inheritance from his great uncle.

	His great uncle died climbing a snow covered mountain. When he reached the top of the mountain he froze to death and died. He was 82.

questions.text: Who plays Frodo Baggins in the "Lord of the Rings" trilogy?
questions.explanation:
Elijah Wood.

	Elijah Wood also plays Sandy in the movie "Flipper".

questions.text: What does the Italian sentence 'Io ho sessantanove anni' translate to in English?
options: I have a sixty-nine year old cat
questions.explanation:
I am sixty-nine.

	Direct translation is I have sixty-nine years.

questions.text: What is the name of the family dog on "7th Heaven"?
questions.explanation:
Happy.

	Happy is the real name of the dog.

questions.text: On "Full House" who used to be named Hermes?
questions.explanation:
Jesse.

	You find this out in the episode where Jesse is obsessed with finding the right names for the twins. It turns out Jesse changed his name after being made fun of in kindergarten.

questions.text: Who was president of the Confederacy during the American Civil War?
questions.explanation:
Jefferson Davis.

	Robert E. Lee was a general. Abraham Lincoln was president of the Union. Thomas Jefferson was 3rd president of the USA.

questions.text: What is 5 to the third power?
questions.explanation:
125.

	You would do it like 5*5*5=125.

questions.text: In the book 'The Princess Diaries', where does Mia keep her diary at the Cultural Diversity Dance.
questions.explanation:
In Lars' briefcase.

	At first she says she isn't going to bring it but asks Lars, her bodyguard, to put it in his briefcase anyway.
